Hail!  sable nurse of Solitude,</br>Where Folly's sons dare not intrude;</br>But Truth, in pensive garb array'd,</br>With Contemplation, sacred maid,</br>Thy deep recesses seek:</br>There Wisdom's voice is heard to speak</br>Of things immortal and profound;</br>Amidst the calm of Nature's sleep,</br>Pale Melancholy treads thy hallow'd ground,</br>And far from mortal eye presumes to weep.

See from the western hemisphere</br>Cynthia in dignity appear;</br>Swift o'er the spangled sky</br>Transparent clouds in mingled beauty fly;</br>The fields assume</br>A silver bloom,</br>The favour'd walk</br>Where whispering lovers talk,</br>And yonder brown-arch'd grove,</br>Where Disappointment loves to rove,</br>And wing'd Reflection soars away;</br>Derive their lustre from her mournful ray.

Pale regent of the Night,</br>Affliction wooes thy melancholy light;</br>Thy milder beams bestow</br>A soothing interval to woe:</br>Ineffable delight!</br>Here let me pause and contemplate</br>The changes of this mortal state,</br>Survey the map of human life,</br>And look beyond its transitory strife.

Memory, thy varied stores display,</br>Let busy thought the scatter'd forms collect;</br>This solemn hour is suited to reflect</br>On all the storms of Life's uncertain day.</br>With Recollection's sigh I view</br>Scenes misery never knew,</br>When anguish never forc'd the furrowing tear,</br>But youth, unsullied, hail'd the new-born year;</br>When inoffensive mirth stood smiling by,</br>With happiness and sweet vivacity.

Ah!  happy hours of undisturb'd repose,</br>When Innocence serenity bestows;</br>When simple sports the infant mind can please,</br>And woe lies buried in the lap of ease!</br>Regretted moments!  never to return:</br>Elate with joy, how oft did I discern</br>Felicity unparallel'd to come,</br>When competence should yield a future home;</br>Where manhood's riper day</br>Should taste the pleasures of domestic love:</br>'Twas thus Imagination smooth'd the way,</br>And Fancy pointed to th' Elysian grove.

Soon sad Experience saw the vision fade;</br>Grief's undulating shower</br>Dissolv'd th' enchanted bower;</br>Scorn drew the poniard of Despair, and Hope decay'd:</br>Yet her exhaustless light</br>Some consolation gives,</br>To blast that deadly sprite</br>Her fading flame revives;</br>Midst mental earthquakes cheers the sinking soul,</br>Directs the mind to her immortal goal.</br>Thus borne on Expectation's wing,</br>We laugh amid the vernal spring,</br>Till winter's sullen wave</br>Sweep, every pleasure to an early grave;</br>Then view the dismal scenery around,</br>And look for peace where sorrow find, a bound!</br>Terrestrial bliss, terrestrial woes,</br>Are hastening to their close;</br>Time, with resistless force,</br>Pursues his unabating course;</br>Makes no delay to give his hunters breath,</br>But rushes forward to the gates of Death.

Let Resignation reign;</br>A few successive years</br>All sublunary pain</br>Will cease, this vale of tears,</br>This scene of trial, for that place exchang'd</br>Where harmony shall be no more derang'd!</br>Thus speaks Religion undefil'd,</br>Her look benign, her accents mild;</br>She holds the gracious invitation forth,</br>Her standard rais'd to save the sons of earth.</br>Sweet messenger of peace!</br>Bid baleful Discord cease;</br>The sainted Hypocrite unmask</br>Who turns thy pages to a task,</br>And for Corruption's venal hire</br>Kindles the flames of Superstition's fire:</br>Let Bigotry, with hellish mien</br>And dagger drawn — no more be seen;</br>O!  spread thy tidings to the farthest shore,</br>Till war shall cease, and vice be felt no more!</br>
